mods.abstract: Letter from Willie Blount (1768-1835), former Governor of Tennessee, to Dr. J.G.M. Ramsey ,Mecklinburgh, near Knoxville, East Tennessee (president of the Antiquarian Historical Society of East Tennessee), Clarksville (Montgomery County), TN. January 1835, ALS 1 pc. Brief paragraph by Ramsey added to bottom. I "CLARKSVILLE, TEN" and "FREE" hand stamp in top right corner.(Free franked on Ramsey's appointment as postmaster at Knoxville.) Small seal at back. "Answered Feb 16, 1835." Blount responds to his selection as an honorary member of the society, promising to send information to the society about his term as governor of Tennessee and other items from his life and career. The letter was written the year of Blount’s death. “Gift of Frank H. Pettway and Jonathan H. Burnett, in memory of Walter F. (Ted) Cameron.”
